item.title: Qantas discloses cyberattack amid Scattered Spider aviation breaches
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Australian airline Qantas disclosed that it detected a cyberattack on Monday after threat actors gained access to a third-party platform containing customer data. [...]

item.title: AT&T rolls out "Wireless Lock" feature to block SIM swap attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: AT&T has launched a new security feature called "Wireless Lock" that protects customers from SIM swapping attacks by preventing changes to their account information and the porting of phone numbers while the feature is enabled. [...]

item.title: Microsoft open-sources VS Code Copilot Chat extension on GitHub
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft has released the source code for the GitHub Copilot Chat extension for VS Code under the MIT license. [...]

item.title: Kelly Benefits says 2024 data breach impacts 550,000 customers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Kelly & Associates Insurance Group (dba Kelly Benefits) is informing more than half a million people of a data breach that compromised their personal information. [...]

item.title: Aeza Group sanctioned for hosting ransomware, infostealer servers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has sanctioned Russian hosting company Aeza Group and four operators for allegedly acting as a bulletproof hosting company for ransomware gangs, infostealer operations, darknet drug markets, and Russian disinformation campaigns. [...]

item.title: New FileFix attack runs JScript while bypassing Windows MoTW alerts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new FileFix attack allows executing malicious scripts while bypassing the Mark of the Web (MoTW) protection in Windows by exploiting how browsers handle saved HTML webpages. [...]

item.title: International Criminal Court hit by new 'sophisticated' cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: On Monday, the International Criminal Court (ICC) announced that it's investigating a new "sophisticated" cyberattack that targeted its systems last week. [...]

item.title: US disrupts North Korean IT worker "laptop farm" scheme in 16 states
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) announced coordinated law enforcement actions against North Korean government's fund raising operations using remote IT workers. [...]

item.title: Esse Health says recent data breach affects over 263,000 patients
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Esse Health, a healthcare provider based in St. Louis, Missouri, is notifying over 263,000 patients that their personal and health information was stolen in an April cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Johnson Controls starts notifying people affected by 2023 breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Building automation giant Johnson Controls is notifying individuals whose data was stolen in a massive ransomware attack that impacted the company's operations worldwide in September 2023. [...]

item.title: Google fixes fourth actively exploited Chrome zero-day of 2025
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google has released emergency updates to patch another Chrome zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks, marking the fourth such flaw fixed since the start of the year. [...]

item.title: U.S. warns of Iranian cyber threats on critical infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: U.S. cyber agencies, the FBI, and NSA issued an urgent warning today about potential cyberattacks from Iranian-affiliated hackers targeting U.S. critical infrastructure. [...]

item.title: Germany asks Google, Apple to remove DeepSeek AI from app stores
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Berlin Commissioner for Data Protection has formally requested Google and Apple to remove the DeepSeek AI application from the application stores due to GDPR violations. [...]
